description: From Middle English recommenden, from Old French recommender (compare French recommander), from Latin re- + commendƒÅre.

verbs.description: recommend (third-person singular simple present recommends, present participle recommending, simple past and past participle recommended)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To bestow commendation on; to represent favourably; to suggest, endorse or encourage as an appropriate choice.
examples: The board recommends Philips, given his ample experience in similar positions.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make acceptable; to attract favor to.
examples: A city that has much to recommend it.
The therapist recommends resting the mind and exercising the body.
My therapist recommended that I rest the mind and exercise the body.

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic) To commit, confide to another's care, confidence or acceptance, with favoring representations
examples: A medieval oblate's parents recommended the boy for life to God and the monastery.
